newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal's Petrogal says Angolan oil well positive.
newsitem.headline: Portugal's Petrogal says Angolan oil well positive.

text.p: Portuguese state oil firm Petrogal-Petroleos de Portugal said on Thursday that a consortium of which it is a member seeking oil in Bloc 14 off northern Angola had obtained "positive results" from a test well.
Initial results indicated a combined volume of about 7,500 barrels of oil per day (bpd), Petrogal said.
Portugal's Publico newspaper said on Thursday it had learned that Petrogal's stake in Bloc 14 could provide a third of Portugal's primary energy needs.

A Portuguese oil industry official, who asked not to be identified, told Reuters that Publico may be right, but that it was still too early to say whether the dimension of the find would be as optimistic as the newspaper said.
Publico quoted Petrogal's president Manuel Ferreira de Oliveira as saying that the discovery could represent the "partial satisfaction of the supply needs" of the company.

Apart from Petrogal's nine percent stake in Bloc 14, operator Cabgoc (affiliated to U.S. Chevron Corp) has 31 percent, Angolan state oil company Sonangol, Italy's Agip and France's Total each have 20 percent.
"A deeper evaluation of the discovery will be needed before forming a development plan," Petrogal said. RTR DB
